name: Yum Cha Chinese Kitchen & Bar å§‘è‹é‡Œ
address: 228 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Absolutely worth the stop.  Quaint little restaurant off the beaten path. The atmosphere was great and the food was amazing!  Totally recommend stopping by.
Food is good. Staff are really helpful and nice.
Good food with friendly service

Enjoyed the meal here especially the vegetarian fried rice and l edamame. While the quality was good, many dishes were too salty for my preference. Also, the stir-fried cabbage could have been better, as it was excessively greasy.

I agree with other reviewers about service. Restaurant seemed busy at the time and service was very rushed, needs improvement for sure.
Great service and cocktails! Loved the dishes and presentation
Very good!!
ç‰¹åˆ«æ­£å®—çš„ä¸­é¤ï¼Œç¯å¢ƒä¹Ÿå¥½
Apex Suzhou food, great service, perfect double cooked pork
Food is great!
This restaurant is amazing! You have to try the porcini mushroom rice!!! Highly recommend!

I was walking through the neighborhood when I came across this place. I was actually planning to go to the ramen spot next door, but Iâ€™m so glad I didnâ€™t! I decided to try the beef noodle soup, and it was absolutely delicious â€” rich, flavorful, and super satisfying. I canâ€™t wait to come back soon!

I was looking forward to trying Yum Cha due to the positive reviews I saw online. Unfortunately, I had an unpleasant experience here. The waitress acted as if we barely existed and was very dismissive, especially when I asked her about vegetarian options. I understand restaurants get busy, but she tried to grab my credit card when I tapped to pay in order to hasten the experience. Overall left feeling very underwhelmed by a place that had strong potential.

I donâ€™t think they deserve the high ratings and I suspect that those might have been paid reviews? Anyways, the food is med to begin with, not bad, but nothing impressive, neither. What really bothered me was the service. The waitresses were close to non-existent and we waited nearly 20 minutes for them to finish chatting at a restaurant corner to resume to their work and give us the check, and I noticed other customers had a hard time getting their attention, too. They also acted rough when serving food/water â€” everything was almost dumped on our table. I was also very surprised that they did not provide at least a small bowl and spoon for eating soup dumplings, which is a standard practice for soup dumpling restaurants (they only provided a large, round, and flat plate, which was not ideal for most Asian food).
Really, really good Chinese food! After our first time, we came back for the delicious ha gow, mongolian beef and sechuan fried chicken.
The taste of the food was either too sweet or too salty. The waitress was poker face when she serviced us. Will never come back again, wonâ€™t recommend to anyone.
Loved the silky tofu with mushrooms and eggplant dishes.  Highly recommend!!!

Every part of the experience reflects care for customers. The food quality stems from what they start with. This restaurant maintains incredible standards. The staff showed exceptional care! This place offers reliable quality.

It was a great experience. The service was good, and the food was delicious.
Dimsum served cold and not tasty. Soup dumplings had no soup and all dried up.  Barely any service or attention.. Other entree meh. Dont understand the high ratings. Cute decor but thats about it.
Chicken soup dumplings so yum
fantastic dining experience. dim sum was some of the best Iâ€™ve ever had
Amazing authentic Chinese food over here. It was so unexpectedly delicious at such a place! Highly recommended
The food was very good and so was the service, I really liked the sweet and sour pork and so was the beef

One of the waitresses was extremely rude. I get you might be having a bad day but that doesnâ€™t mean you can mistreat costumers. Which is a shame, though, because the food was really good. Wouldnâ€™t go back just because of that.
è¶…çº§å¥½åƒ
è¶…çº§å¥½åƒå›å®¶äº†å…„å¼Ÿä»¬

I highly recommend you check this place out. The chicken dumplings are top notch. Visiting from Florida it was a great experience. The staff was courteous, funny, and welcoming. tucked away and perfect for a nice evening in NYC.

Caught up with a dear friend, wanted to find some place not too loud that we could talk and catch up. We picked the right place, not too loud, the food was great, my friend really liked the drinks. We had a great time. Thank you and we'll ba back again.
The food was delicious , totally recommend
We are foodies from Taiwan and really enjoyed the food. Awesome service!!! Loved every dish! Not just some American Chinese food joint.
Very good pretty decor, good pork dunplings
The food experience changes over time. We visited several times. For the same orders, sometimes we got good quantity, but sometimes you can hardly find it's worth the money.

I have high standards for modern Chinese restaurants and every expectation of mine was blown away. The stir fried beef with peppers, garlic and cilantro was one of the best beef dishes Iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure of eating, and my wife loved the black truffle fried rice. Every bite was addicting and the service was warm, attentive and cheerful. Will be coming again soon :)
Very delicious, authentic, and great service. Clean and beautifully decorated.

Their reservation list fills quickly due to high demand. This restaurant balances good looks with truly welcoming service. The team demonstrates unparalleled friendliness and readily provides recommendations when you seem unsure. Every dish benefits from genuine effort. This restaurant enriches our local options.
Chereen was fantastic!  The food and atmosphere was so great, weâ€™ve been here twice! I highly recommend this great place if youâ€™re in NYC!
Absolument dÃ©licieux !!! Le cadre est confortable et agrÃ©able, le service trÃ¨s bon et la nourriture vraiment savoureuse. Je recommande!!!

Wanted a quick dinner and past by this cute restaurant, food came so quickly even tho there were only two waitresses and all the tables were full! Food was filling and delicious! Will definitely come back again and recommend to my friends!
Really fresh and flavorful, will be coming back very soon!
The food was so so soooo good, definitely coming back!!
Had a delicious meal! The pork was cooked wonderfully and so tender!
Amazing service! Great food!
good environment, and nice food

good(à¹‘â€¢Ì€ã…‚â€¢Ì)Ùˆâœ§

Thereâ€™s a lot of modern Chinese restaurants in NYC nowadays and Yum Cha is definitely a solid spot to dine at for elevated comfort Chinese food, dim sum, and drinks.

The Pomelo Tea and Strawberry Probiotic Bliss were both great drink choices. I liked the Chicken Soup Dumplings, but wish it had more soup inside. The Steamed Pork Buns were steamed really well and had lots of filling inside.

The Stewed Tofu W. Minced Crab Meats was silky and paired well with white rice on the side. For a veggie dish, definitely get the Stir Fried String Bean W. Minced Pork. I also tried their hearty Braised Beef Noodle Soup and for dessert, got the Crispy Fried Milk.

10/10 food, service and ambience! We ordered a couple of dim sum, entrees, and dessert to share in a group of three. The portion size was good, especially for the hot stone porcini mushroom rice. My favorite had to be the sweet and sour ribs. Very flavorful.

I would totally recommend Yum Cha if you are in the area. The location is convenient because it is only a few blocks away from Washington Square Park.

The dining space is elegant. Absolutely loved the dining booths with comfy sofa.

This cozy basement restaurant serves stunning Chinese cuisine, focusing on Jiangsu-Zhejiang (Jiangzhe) flavors with Sichuan and Northern influences. The â€œLittle Oil Eel Threadsâ€ was a standoutâ€”crispy, flavorful, and fishy-free. The Squirrel-Shaped Mandarin Fish, with its sweet-savory sauce, was perfect for sweet-toothed diners. The Shanghai Greens were tender and rich, cooked with a high-broth-like depth.

The menu offers diverse, authentic dishes at reasonable prices. I avoided spicy Sichuan options, but my friends loved them. The open bar adds a lively vibe, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Despite the small space, every dish impressed. Conveniently near a subway and NYU, itâ€™s a must-visit for quality Chinese food in Manhattan. Canâ€™t wait to return!

The newly updated menu is amazing! Every dish feels thoughtfully crafted â€” the soup dumplings are juicy, the sweet & sour ribs are crispy and flavorful, and the beef with porcini rice is just irresistible. Beautiful interior with a touch of Jiangnan elegance. One of the best Chinese restaurants Iâ€™ve tried in Manhattan!

I had an incredible dining experience at Yum Cha! The **Shredded Garlic with Truffle Steak Cube** and **Yum Cha Black Fish** were absolute standoutsâ€”each bite was packed with rich, savory flavors that blended perfectly. The steak cubes were tender, infused with the aromatic depth of truffle and garlic, while the black fish was beautifully cooked, delicate, and flavorful. To top it all off, closing the meal with **Egg Milk Rice** was the perfect way to goâ€”comforting, creamy, and satisfying. The balance of flavors throughout the meal was simply outstanding. Iâ€™ll definitely be returning for another round!

Highly recommended for anyone looking for an exceptional Yum Cha experience.

Yumcha NYC is an absolute gem for Chinese food lovers! We kicked off our meal with refreshing drinks â€” the Young Coconut and Passion Fruit Mocktail â€” and followed with an incredible lineup of dumplings, including juicy Crystal Shrimp, Chicken, and Shrimp Dumplings. The mains brought the heat with crispy and tender General Tso Chicken, and a flavor-packed Spicy Fried Chicken in Chili my favorite. We also tried the Kung Pao chicken which was ok. But the real star was the Black Truffle Fried Rice â€” rich, aromatic, and completely addictive. The vibe is trendy yet cozy, making it perfect for group hangs or a dim sum date night in NYC. Highly recommend!

The food at Yum Cha was overall quite good â€” Iâ€™d give the dishes 4 stars. The black truffle fried rice was flavorful and well-executed, and the lychee shrimp balls were creative and refreshing. Definitely some thoughtful touches on the menu.

However, the dining experience was seriously let down by the service and environment. We visited on a very cold and windy day, and were seated right by the entrance â€” which unfortunately had a broken door. Staff were attempting to fix the door during service, but it kept swinging open, letting freezing wind blast into the restaurant.

Our food got cold almost immediately, and the entire meal was uncomfortably chilly. After dinner, I ended up with a really bad stomach ache, which honestly ruined the night.

Itâ€™s a shame because the kitchen clearly puts effort into the food, but the lack of consideration for customer comfort and poor service left a bad impression. Iâ€™d only consider coming back if the space and hospitality improve.

So happy to see the modern Chinese food scene growing in NYC. Yum Cha is a tapas style modern Chinese restaurant right next to Washington Square Park and NYU.

The service here was super friendly, and I loved how classy yet intimate the dining space felt.

ï¼ŠDeep Fried Cheese Shrimp è”æ±è¦çƒ $21.99 *
Literally a showstopper. This gorgeous lychee shrimp tree here reimagines familiar flavors with so much creativity. The lychee paste mixed with cheese gave a savory note. Super fun and oddly satisfying) to pluck the lychees off the tree.

ï¼ŠPorcini Mushroom Beef Rice çŸ³é‹ç‰›è‚èŒæ‹Œé£¯ $27.99**
It came in a sizzling hot stone pot that kept it warm the entire meal. It was saucy, with a meaty flavor from the porcini mushrooms and a kick from the green pepper. The portion was huge and easily enough to feed four.

ï¼ŠSweet and Sour Ribs ç³–é†‹æ’éª¨ $24.99**
We were asked to try their sweet and sour ribs, and it ended up being my favorite dish.Â I usually donâ€™t enjoy eating around bones, but these were braised so tender they fell off easily. Very saucy and savory, perfect with white rice or their porcini mushroom rice.

ï¼ŠGolden Black Phoenix Bun é»‘é‡‘æµæ²™åŒ… $9.99
Fluffy bun with the satisfying moment when the salted egg yolk lava oozed out. I just wish there was a bit more filling at this price point.

ï¼ŠCrab Roe Mixed Noodle èŸ¹é»ƒæ‹Œéºµ $18.99
The noodles were drenched in a vibrant orange pool of crab roe and shrimp. Visually promising yet flavor-wise, the crab roe was faint. We were reminded to mix everything quickly, or the noodles would stick together.

ï¼ŠCrispy Fried Milk ç‚¸é®®å¥¶ $10.99
Creamy milk custard in a light fried batter, served alongside condensed milk. A not-too-sweet sweet treat to wrap up the feast.

ï¼ŠStrawberry Probiotic Bliss $9.50
ï¼ŠPeach Oolong Elixir $9.50
Their non-alcoholic drinks were surprisingly good, comparable to the quality you could get at a boba spot.

Overall rating: 4.7

I went here with a group of 7 and they do NOT split bills. Be warned. But! The food was actually really delicious. The soup dumplings were really small and not worth it. My favorite was the Dan Dan noodles. They were surprisingly really good. Really spicy. In good way! The general tsao chicken was not good. The item they cook in a pot was delicious too. Wish I was able to take more pictures but I forgot at one point. Will def be coming back & highly recommend!

Dining area: spacious, booths and regular tables.
Food: amazing, delicious and presented beautifully.
Soups, meat, cold appetizers, hot appetizers - so good!
Their drinks were also on point and original

This is a popular Chinese restaurant in SOHO.  The Procini Mushroom Beef Rice is delicious and my favorite.  It would taste even better if the server wait a few minutes before mix ing it, so the rice gets more crispy in the hot stone bowl.  The Truffle Ribeye Cube is yummy but lack of truffle favor.  The presentation of Deep-Fried Cheese Shrimp W. Snap Pea is very special and picture perfect, however the taste is just okay. It would be a wonderful addition if the restaurant offered complimentary house tea, as is customary in many authentic Chinese restaurants.

å¾ˆé€‚åˆèšé¤åƒé¥­çš„é¤å…ï¼Œè…°èŠ±å‘³é“ä¸é”™ï¼Œå¹²ç…¸é³ä¸å¾ˆé…¥è„†é€‚åˆä¸‹é…’ã€‚æ°´ç…®è‚‰ç‰‡æ˜¯æçš„æœ€å¹²å‡€çš„èœï¼ï¼
å»ºè®®ä¸­åˆæ¥ç”¨é¤ï¼Œæ¯”æ™šé¤äººå°‘ã€‚

From the outside, this seems like an unassuming regular Chinese restaurant; however, upon entering, one is greeted by an entirely different atmosphere. The vibrant royal blue furnishings, combined with unique decor, significantly enhance the overall dining experience. The restaurant offers an array of delightful Asian beverages. Looking around, youâ€™d see diners taking photos at every table. The dishes are not only visually striking but also highly enticing.

The Chinese cuisine served here ranks among the finest I have encountered in New York. Each dish is expertly seasoned, generously sauced, and artfully presented for the diner's pleasure.

This is a MUST TRY!

I tried several signature dishes at this restaurant, but they were a complete letdown the meat was super dry bzc of over cook, exceedingly salty, and far from the refined taste I expected. Thatâ€™s called â€œTruffle Ribeye Cube $42.99â€ was extremely terrible! The waitress was totally in rush all the time and she not even ask me about how do I like to cook the steak.
Overall, this dining experience didnâ€™t feel â€œworth it.â€ Compared to what was shown in the menu photos and advertising on the social media, the real experience was worlds apart. If you expect good taste and attentive service, youâ€™re likely to be very disappointed here.

å¾ˆå¥½åƒ å®¶çš„å‘³é“ï¼šï¼‰
ç¬‹å„¿å¥½åƒ ç‰›è‚èŒé¥­å¾ˆç»
ã€Œæˆ‘ä»¬åƒå¾—å¤šã€

This place seriously hits the spot if youâ€™re craving real Sichuan. We had the dry pot bull frog, the flavours were cooked perfectly into the frogs. Honestly, if youâ€™ve never had frog before, this is the move. The stir-fried beef slapped too, very juicy.

Our absolute favourite is was the porcini mushroom beef fried rice. we were literally fighting over the last bite. Portions are solid, service is quick, and the whole vibe feels like a low-key food coma waiting to happen. 100% coming back.
Porchini Mushroom Beef Rice was so good! So mush flavor with pepper kick. Other dishes were great in general. Clean atmosphere and fast service.

Absolutely loved this place! The food was delicious, the service was attentive and friendly, and the overall atmosphere was just right â€” cozy but not too noisy. Perfect spot for a casual get-together or a small celebration. Highly recommend!

I found this restaurant by searching for nearby eateries. The storefront is small but very exquisite, and the environment is quite nice. However, the lone server seemed a bit overwhelmed. The dishes all tasted good, though the stinky tofu was a bit salty. The fish-flavored shredded pork is highly recommended, my child also really enjoyed this dish. I will definitely come back next time.

I had this restaurant on my list for a while, and it definitely lived up to the hype! They do a great job blending traditional Chinese flavors with a modern twist.

I started with the Steamed Pork & Shrimp Dumpling and Pork Soup Dumplingâ€”both were super juicy and flavorful. Special mention to the Deep-Fried Cheese Shrimp with Snap Pea, which comes on a tree! The little lychee-shaped bites were crispy, cheesy, and so fun to eat.

For mains, I tried the Crystal Shrimp, Truffle Ribeye Cube, Porcini Mushroom Beef Rice, and General Tsoâ€™s Chicken. Everything was packed with flavor!

Even though I was already full, I had to try dessert. The Coconut Pudding was light and refreshing, but the Egg & Milk in Fermented Rice Wine stole the showâ€”crispy, sweet, and so unique.

The cocktails (YuZu Rita and Farewell My Concubine) were just as good as the food, beautifully presented and really well-balanced.

The vibe was super chill and the decor was really classy and put together.

Overall, such a great experience! Canâ€™t wait to go back and try more. Highly recommend!

This restaurant is my go-to spot for traditional Shanghai cuisine and array of dim sum tapas.
We ordered a bunch of dishes from different categories. All the food were delicious and flavorful. Must-try is the Truffle rib-eye cube.
I donâ€™t know how they cooked it but the meat was so tender and flavorful. The bean curd with shrimp meat and vegi from dimsum menu was also very good. You should also get the Shanghai crispy smoke fish . The cocktails here are also very creative . If you are up for a fun dining experience with mouthwatering eats, this place is a must-try!

Featuring â¤µï¸
-Shanghai crispy smoke fish
-Spare ribs garlic sauce
-Crab meat and fish maw soup ( small )
-Bean curd with shrimp meat and vegetables
-Clay pot prawn in garlic sauce
-Boneless Mandarin Fish with sweet and sour sauce
-Truffle Rib eye cube
-Beef chow fun
-Farewell my concubine (cocktail)

Looking for good dim sum? You will not disappointed here. Itâ€™s not fancy place but their food is good. Porcini beef fried rice is really tasty. Not a lot of beef but the taste is really flavorful. I highly recommend this dish.  Their soup dumplings are delicious. I got both pork and crab soup dumplings. I have to order 2nd order for pork dumplings. My son really likes it. The crab one doesnâ€™t have much crab meat inside but the soup inside tastes good.

Another dish that I ordered but I donâ€™t recommend is the tree one. Itâ€™s fancy. Good for picture but the taste was ok. Too little of the shrimp meat inside. Too much of the crunchy outside. Itâ€™s kind of plain.

I feel so sorry to have taken my friend here. Honestly I wasnâ€™t happy with a single dish we ordered. They were not authentic at all. Because the ingredients were not good, the bamboo shoot soup had no flavor at all. We even found some sand-like substance in the mushroom beef rice. And the braised pork belly was definitely not freshly cooked. And from time to time I saw flies around.
Overall it was a terrible experience eating here.

I had the pleasure of dining here recently, and the experience was fantastic. The food was bursting with authentic flavors, especially the spicy soup, which had the perfect balance of heat and savory goodness. The stir-fried dish with a mix of fresh veggies and tender meat was also cooked to perfection, with every bite packed with rich and satisfying taste. The presentation of the dishes, as seen in the photos, was appealing, making the meal even more enjoyable.

The atmosphere of the restaurant felt cozy and welcoming, complemented by friendly service. Everything, from the attention to detail in the decor to the vibrant food, made this a top-notch dining experience. Whether youâ€™re a fan of bold flavors or more subtle dishes, thereâ€™s something here for everyone.

Highly recommend this place for anyone craving delicious Chinese cuisine in a relaxed yet stylish setting!
éš¾åƒçš„ä¸€é€¼ï¼Œå“æ²¹é³ä¸å…¨æ˜¯ç¡¬çš„è¿˜æœ‰éª¨å¤´ï¼Œç³–é†‹æ’éª¨å’Œçº¢çƒ§è‚‰ä¸€ä¸ªå‘³é“

Amazing Chinese cuisine. I had chicken soup dumplings, General Tso chicken, wontons and potatoes and everything was very delicious. Food came out fast and the waiter and ambience was delightful. Prices wasnâ€™t bad either! Definitely recommend.
è¶…çº§å¥½åƒï¼ï¼èƒ½åƒåˆ°å¾ˆå¹¸ç¦çš„(=Â´âˆ€ï½€)äºº(Â´âˆ€ï½€=)ï¼

I went there with some girlfriends last night. Great food, drinks and services. I love how they incorporated traditional Chinese hard liquor into their cocktail menu and made them delicious. And did you see how cute the glasses are?? Food was also great. Soup dumplings were among the best in the city. There were also many classic Shanghainess dishes.  As someone originally from there, some of the dishes could be a tad sweeter, but they were just right for my  friends ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚. Will definitely go back.

We were expecting American Chinese flavors, but were delighted that they have closer to authentic Chinese flavors. The pork dumplings with spicy sauce were yummy, the ma po tofu, made vegetarian was spicy and good. We had the shredded potatoes, which were very delicious. The hot and sour soup was good as well. They have free flavorful peanuts on yoyr table, great but be aware they are not vegetarian. We recommend Yum Cha!
10/10, will definitely be back - had the tsao chicken, ribs, fried rice and spring rolls. Everything was authentic and amazing

Ambiance (5/5): The restraurant is very nicely decorated with a clean, modern spin Asian decor. Thereâ€™s intimiate dining spots with private nooks which could be nice for larger parties. Sections of the dining area have booth seating around the inner side. Thereâ€™s also a full bar with bar seating too.  The inside was darkly lit with a small table lamp for ambiance lighting.
Service (5/5): We were seated immediately on a Saturday night for our party of 2 around 530pm and there was plenty of seating. Whenever we needed service, it was easy to flag down the staff.
Table seasonings were provided which included 3 sauces including a soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil. Loved the chili oil!
Pork soup dumplings (2/5): Very meh as it tasted like the dumplings could have been frozen instead of fresh, indicated by the bite of the inner meat which was more clumped than loose. But the broth was not super flavorful.
Dan Dan noodles (5/5): The portion was small but the flavor was very rich of a nutty flavor, creamy, and spicy. I loved this dish!
Szechuan style diced chicken w chili (2/5): There was way too much breading to the small chunks of chicken. I was eating more of the breading than chicken. The spice level is pretty mild despite all the chili that might make it look spicier. The meal does not come with any side of rice but the dish was not too salty or spicy that it required it (good thing!) The flavor was great though.

Just went here today with my friend. We ordered 2 dishes, the rice cake and crab roe noodles. I think I like the crab roe noodles more than the rice cake. The restaurant was not that crowded when we came, and the staffs were nice

Visited this restaurant twice already. I was missing Chinese food (especially Shanghai cuisine) too much, given that itâ€™s been eight years since i was home last time. Of course, there remain gaps from the authentic cuisine that you would have back in China, but this is probably the best you can have. This is place is also clean without worrying too much about sanitation or safety issues you may have in restaurants in Flushing. We have tried : shredded lettuce salad, mandarin fish with sweat sour sauce, shredded eel, salted egg pumpkin, and all of them met my expectations.

When u canâ€™t make two simple drinks you know there is going to be trouble. A simple martini and an old fashion were UGH!!!

The appetizer came out in the middle of the meal. Some excuse about something wasnâ€™t turned on. The dishes were not cold but lukewarm warm and obvious pre cooked.

I was so embarrassed because I was taking a client out for the New Year, sadly I picked the place from its reviews. Next time he said, he will take me to a better place to celebrate lunar New Year. Luckily, I ran into friends who also were going to try the food here but my friend gave them a better suggestion. Even cold the rib dish tasted ok.

Iâ€™m really glad a new dimsum/Shanghainese place opened! The atmosphere was on the more upscale side, but thank god the prices are still reasonable. Everything was very good, and the service was amazing. Thank you for an amazing first experience! Iâ€™ll be sure to get a drink from the bar next time
Great atmosphere, delightful cocktails, AMAZING fried pork dumplings, and attentive service

Service here is very good. The waitresses are friendly, warm and patient. And the food I  love stirred fried beef with cilantro &pepper and cheese shrimp with snap pea is amazing! They are so delicious. I have a very good experience here !

Love this place! Went there in January and knew our next trip back to NYC we would have to go again. Restaurant is clean, cute. Service is friendly and excellent. Had broccoli with garlic, stir fried beef with cilantro and peppers, pork dumplings, and our favorite, cabbage with chilis. The prosecco was also excellent. Highly recommend!
